Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as wine of the scribe Se-.. (?).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Egypt Exploration Society (by inference)
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (395079) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/395079)
